title: Apply the Integral of a Sum and Difference Property
text: For addition, $$\int_{a}^{b} f{\left(x\right)}+g{\left(x\right)} \,dx=\int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx+\int_{a}^{b} g(x) \,dx$$. In other words, the integral of a sum is the sum of the integrals. For subtraction, $$\int_{a}^{b} f(x)-g(x) \,dx=\int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx-int{g(x),a,b,x}$$. This means separating the terms into three different integrals with the appropriate sign.
